question: Three energy levels of hydrogen atom and the corresponding wavelength of the emitted radiation due to different electron transition are as shown. Then.

explanation: Energy <katex>$E = hc/\lambda$</katex>. The energy gap for <katex>$\lambda_2$</katex> (largest gap) is sum of gaps for <katex>$\lambda_1$</katex> and <katex>$\lambda_3$</katex>. <katex>$E_2 = E_1 + E_3$</katex> (assuming indices correspond to gaps). <katex>$\frac{hc}{\lambda_2} = \frac{hc}{\lambda_1} + \frac{hc}{\lambda_3}$</katex>. <katex>$\frac{1}{\lambda_2} = \frac{1}{\lambda_1} + \frac{1}{\lambda_3}$</katex>. Solving gives <katex>$\lambda_2 = \frac{\lambda_1 \lambda_3}{\lambda_1 + \lambda_3}$</katex>.
